frame.name: Emotion_heat
frame.definition: <def-root>This frame contains verbs that describe emotional experiences and participate in the locative alternation. For example: I was <t>boiling</t> with anger. Anger was <t>boiling</t> inside me. While these words might seem to be like support verbs for emotion nouns such as <ment>anger</ment>, the same verbs can be used in the absence of such nouns, e.g. <ment>His remarks made me boil (inside)</ment>. NB: Blends with communication (FE's Add, Msg, Top; part of lemmas seethe.v, fume.v) to be moved.</def-root>

FE.name: Experiencer
FE.definition:
<def-root>The Experiencer is the individual that experiences the <fen>Emotion</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Experiencer">Pat</fex> <t>seethed</t> with rage.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Emotion
FE.definition:
<def-root>The Emotion experienced (usually restricted to words such as <ment>anger, fury, rage, passion</ment>) can occur as the External Argument or in a PP Complement. Alternatively, there may be no expression of Emotion separate from the target verb:
<ex><fex name="Emotion">Rage</fex> <t>boiled</t> inside him.</ex>
<ex>He <t>boiled</t> <fex name="Emotion">with rage</fex>.</ex> <ex>Pat's behavior made me <t>seethe</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Cause
FE.definition: <def-root>The Cause of the Emotion can be expressed in a PP Complement headed by <ment>at</ment>: <ex>Jo <t>burned</t> with shame <fex name="Cause">at the criticism</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Seat of emotion
FE.definition:
<def-root>The words in this frame can occur with an overtly expressed Seat of the Emotion. This frame element occurs as a PP Complement:
<ex>Fury <t>seethed</t> <fex name="sea">within her</fex>.</ex> <ex>I was <t>seething</t> <fex name="sea">inside</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Topic
FE.definition: <def-root>Topic is the entity that the proposition or propositions conveyed relate to, that they are about. Had someone <t>communicated</t> to the capital <fex name="Topic">about the flagrant disregard of the religious law</fex> ? </def-root>

FE.name: Expression
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Expression</fen> is the words or behavior through which the <fen>Emotion</fen> is expressed. <ex><fex name="Emotion">Anger</fex> <t>boiled</t> <fex name="Expression">in every word she said</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: boil.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: (of a person or emotion) be stirred up or inflamed.

lexUnit.name: burn.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: be entirely possessed by (a desire or emotion).

lexUnit.name: chafe.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: become annoyed or impatient because of a restriction or inconvenience

lexUnit.name: seethe.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: be filled with intense but unexpressed anger.

lexUnit.name: simmer.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: be in a state of suppressed anger or excitement.

lexUnit.name: smoulder.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: (with reference to an intense feeling) express or be expressed in a barely suppressed state.

lexUnit.name: stew.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: remain in an anxious or agitated state
